intro: Salsola brachypteris, commonly known as sandmat, is a flowering plant native to arid and semi-arid regions of the Americas. It is a member of the Amaranthaceae family and is characterized by its low, spreading growth habit and small, fleshy leaves. The plant produces greenish-white flowers that are clustered in dense inflorescences, and it is well adapted to survive in harsh, saline environments. Salsola brachypteris is often found in sandy soils and can thrive in areas with limited water availability. Its resilience makes it a common species in desert and coastal ecosystems.
